161354667,"{'steamid': '76561197972538418', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 490, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1711288609}",german,"Relatively short Standalone / DLC for AC Black Flag.
Setting is little different, story is okay, but short. If you liked Black Flag, you will enjoy this little extra playtime.
Separate map and some stuff do, it is alright.
I just played the story to complete my AC collection (only 2 titles left now yay).
Technically it is okayish, there are fixes in wsgf for widescreen resolutions.
Performancewise it is very demanding even nowadays in 2024. When all cranked up it still needs some resources. My PC (5800x3d&7900XTX) was getting warm :).
But looks-wise it is still very acceptable for its age.
Get it for a few bucks if you liked black flag or want to complete your collection",1711289528,1711289528,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

160907447,"{'steamid': '76561198316836129', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1595028162}",german,"## Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry: Ein ermutigendes Abenteuer voller Freiheit

**Schrei nach Freiheit** ist ein eigenständiges Add-on für **Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag**, das die Spieler in die Haut von Adéwalé schlüpfen lässt, einem ehemaligen Sklaven, der zum Assassinen geworden ist. Das Spiel führt uns nach Saint-Domingue, einem von Sklaverei geplagten Land, und erzählt eine fesselnde Geschichte über Rebellion, Widerstand und den Kampf um Freiheit.

**Adéwalé ist ein charismatischer und komplexer Protagonist**, dessen Reise voller emotionaler Momente und moralischer Entscheidungen steckt. Das Spiel wirft wichtige Fragen über die Sklaverei und die Ungerechtigkeit der damaligen Gesellschaft auf und lädt den Spieler dazu ein, sich mit diesen Themen auseinanderzusetzen.

**Die Spielwelt von Saint-Domingue ist wunderschön und abwechslungsreich**. Von üppigen Dschungeln bis hin zu den geschäftigen Straßen der Hauptstadt Port-au-Prince bietet die Welt viel Platz zum Erkunden und Entdecken.

**Das Gameplay ist flüssig und abwechslungsreich**. Neben den typischen Assassinen-Infiltrationen und Stealth-Missionen bietet Freedom Cry auch spannende Seeschlachten und neue Gameplay-Elemente wie die Befreiung von Sklaven und die Sabotage von Plantagen.
**Die Geschichte ist fesselnd und gut erzählt**. Die Missionen sind abwechslungsreich und voller spannender Momente. Die Charaktere sind gut entwickelt und glaubwürdig.
**Die Grafik ist auf einem hohen Niveau** und die Atmosphäre ist stimmungsvoll. Der Soundtrack ist hervorragend und unterstreicht die emotionale Wirkung des Spiels.

**Fazit:** Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry ist ein empfehlenswertes Spiel für alle Fans der Reihe und für Spieler, die sich für Geschichte und die Thematik der Sklaverei interessieren. Das Spiel bietet eine spannende Geschichte, abwechslungsreiches Gameplay und eine wunderschöne Spielwelt.
**Positiv:**
* Charismatischer und komplexer Protagonist
* Fesselnde Geschichte über Rebellion und Freiheit
* Abwechslungsreiches Gameplay
* Wunderschöne Spielwelt
* Gute Grafik und Atmosphäre
* Herausfordernde Missionen
**Negativ:**
* Relativ kurze Spielzeit
* Einige technische Probleme
**Bewertung:** 8/10

160766362,"{'steamid': '76561198951092603', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1710684960}",russian,топ прошел за сегодня)тут всего 9 заданий,1710684978,1710684978,True,0,0,0,0,False,False,False,True,,,

160170465,"{'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1709934359}",german,"Black Flag Jr. war ursprünglich ein DLC, wurde dann aber (auch) als eigenständiges Spiel herausgegeben.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3176059895
[b]Geschichte[/b]

Wir spielen Adèwalè, der Quartiermeister unter Edward Kenway war und nun, wo dieser vermutlich in England eine ruhige Kugel schiebt, ein eigenes Schiff befehligt. Er ist ehemaliger Sklave mit guten Überzeugungen, Assassine und Freiheitskämpfer.

In der interessanten Geschichte, die in Saint-Domingue (dem heutigen Haiti) von 1735 spielt, geht es neben bekannten Themen insbesondere um Sklaverei, Sklavenbefreieungen und um die befreiten Sklaven, den [url=https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maroons]Maroons[/url].

Es wird aber nicht die ganz große (historische) Geschichte erzählt, sondern eher nur eine kleine Auseinandersetzung, die, wenn man so will, pars pro toto steht. Adèwalès Diskussion mit der Bordellchefin Bastienne über das richtige Vorgehen geht in diese Richtung, es gibt wohl nicht *den* richtigen Weg.

Bei ein paar Dingen habe ich schon die Stirn gerunzelt und vermute mal, sie sind dem Gameplay geschuldet, so die Sache mit den Sklavenschiffen unter Geleitschutz. Auch gab es sicher enorme Gewalt gegen Sklaven, andererseits waren sie ja Eigentum, das man nicht einfach so mal vernichtet, sondern unter Kontrolle hält, was durchaus bedeuten kann, Aufsässige zu töten, aber nicht wahllos jeden Sklaven.

War Black Flag von der Stimmung her ein her lustiges Abenteuer, ist dieses Spiel hier düster. Dadurch wird es einfach nicht mit dem Überflieger mithalten können. Meine Zurückhaltung liegt aber eher darin begründet, dass es seine Herkunft als DLC nicht abschütteln kann (siehe auch Spielzeit). Dabei wäre das Thema wirklich gut.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3175620921
[b]Gameplay[/b]
Das Gameplay ähnelt dem von Black Flag enorm. Ein paar Missionstypen hat man weggelassen oder in der Stückzahl enorm reduziert. Auffällig, dass die Forts nicht mehr erobert werden müssen.

Neu sind die Sklavenbefreiungsmissionen, von denen es eine ganze Reihe unterschiedlichen Typs gibt. Sehr aufwendig sind die Plantagenbefreiungen bestimmten Typs, bei dem man zu unentdecktem langwierigem Vorgehen gezwungen wird, will man nicht den Tod der zu befreienden Sklaven riskieren.

Ein paar Objekte, wie das eines besonderen Schwerts, sind versteckt und können scheinbar nur durch Suchen oder (wie bei mir) per Zufall gefunden werden. Dummerweise galt dies (wohl unbeabsichtigt) auch für ein paar Schatzkisten, die einfach ""verschwunden"" waren.

Das Schiff kann wie in Black Flag aufgerüstet werden. Der Aufwand hierfür ist aber genauso enorm und für die Hauptquest nicht (oder nur ein wenig) erforderlich. Da stimmen die Dimensionen irgendwie nicht.
Insgesamt fühlt es sich nach noch mehr Black Flag an, auch wenn das Thema Sklaven ein paar neue Events einfügt.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3175621891
[b]Technik[/b]
Technisch ziemlich gut. Das Spiel ist mir nie abgestürzt. Dass ein paar Objekte nicht auffindbar waren hat mich schnell davon abgehalten auf 100% zu gehen.
Die Grafik ist sehr schön, wie in AC IV, und der Sound ist ähnlich gut. Die Dialoge sind auf Deutsch.
Die Steuerung per Controller war sehr gut und praktisch wie in Black Flag.
[b]Sonstiges[/b]
Ich habe etwa 4h für die Hauptquest gebraucht und mich vielleicht nochmal 4h mit Nebenaufgaben beschäftigt.
[code][b]In Zahlen für mich persönlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 7,5/10.[/b][/code]
Ein edler Held auf Sklavenbefreiungsmission. Sonst eher Black Flag in Miniatur.
[hr][/hr]

[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. Für meine Wertung zählt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhängig davon, ob ich es einem ähnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

158917768,"{'steamid': '76561198143017996', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1716, 'last_played': 1708599199}",english,"Would I recommend? Yes, just.
For whatever reason, the Freedom Cry DLC is broken. You can still buy it from Ubisoft but it does. not. work.

The standalone version has a lot of the best bits of Black Flag missing (no sea shanties ?!?!), the map has shrunk, the upgrades are much more limited. And it has lots of the same problems, it glitches, the listening and tailing missions...

Adey is a better lead than Kenway for me, the slave saving mini games are fun, there's no obvious wokery and there is no Animus at all!",1708546593,1708546593,True,1,0,0.487608850002288818,0,True,False,False,True,,,

158707254,"{'steamid': '76561198136258977', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1708335511}",english,"My overall perspective on this is that this is a IGN 7/10 type game. Not bad, not excellent.
Although, of course, this is because of the price that I got it for Rs. 300 INR, which is roughly 3 dollars USD.
This is a DLC released as a standalone game, so while I would have made considerations for it being a DLC, it being a standalone game negates those, so I will judge it as a full-fledged game.

The story is kinda meh. None of the characters have anything resembling a character arc. The story doesn't go any deeper than freeing slaves and the Maroon revolution, which is fine by me to be honest. Black Flag frustrated me a little bit about the indifference to slavery portrayed by Edward Kenway and his mates, and Freedom Cry rectifies it pretty well.
It is, however, extremely short, and the main missions themselves are not very innovative, nor are the side missions either. It is basically Black Flag with different game textures.
Fortunately, Black Flag had an extremely engaging gameplay loop in the naval combat, and that remains the same here.
I encountered a fair bit of bugs and glitches, but that's par for the course for Assassin's Creed.
TL;DR:
Pros:
Black Flag reskin, so glorious naval combat
Game features fighting to free slaves
Cons:
Everything is too short and not particularly deep.

Feels like a tech demo, an in-between between Black Flag and Rogue, with the blunderbuss being similar to the bomb-gun thingy in Rogue, and a few Voice Actors being re-used from Black Flag and in Rogue as well.

TL;DR TL;DR: Get this if you want to spend a fun few hours in the AC: Black Flag naval combat gameplay loop and you don't want the lengthy story or the extensive side-objectives of Rogue and Black Flag.",1708336443,1708336443,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

157907196,"{'steamid': '76561198000649415', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1707462379}",english,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry takes players on a thrilling journey through the brutal realities of slavery in the Caribbean during the 18th century. Serving as a standalone expansion to Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, this game places players in the shoes of Adéwalé, a former slave turned Assassin, as he fights for freedom and justice amidst a world plagued by oppression. With its compelling narrative, immersive setting, and engaging gameplay, Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry offers both a poignant commentary on historical injustices and an exhilarating gaming experience. However, it's not without its flaws.
Pros:

Gripping Narrative: Freedom Cry delivers a powerful and emotional storyline, exploring themes of slavery, freedom, and resistance. Adéwalé's personal journey from a slave to an Assassin leader is both compelling and thought-provoking, immersing players in the harsh realities of the era.

Diverse Setting: Set in the vibrant and diverse Caribbean, the game features stunning visuals and richly detailed environments. From bustling cities to sprawling plantations and dense jungles, the world of Freedom Cry feels alive and immersive, offering plenty of opportunities for exploration.

Meaningful Gameplay: The gameplay mechanics of Freedom Cry build upon the foundation laid by Black Flag, offering a seamless blend of stealth, combat, and exploration. Players can engage in thrilling naval battles, liberate slaves, and undertake various missions to undermine the oppressive regime, providing a sense of agency and empowerment.

Social Commentary: Freedom Cry doesn't shy away from addressing the horrors of slavery and the legacy of colonialism. Through its narrative and gameplay, the game prompts players to confront uncomfortable truths about the past while highlighting the resilience and strength of those who fought against injustice.
Cons:

Repetitive Missions: Despite its compelling narrative, Freedom Cry suffers from some repetitive mission structures. Players may find themselves engaging in similar tasks such as freeing slaves or assassinating targets multiple times, which can lead to a sense of monotony over extended play sessions.

Limited Exploration: While the Caribbean setting is visually stunning, the game's world can feel somewhat limited compared to the vast open seas of Black Flag. Players may find themselves craving more opportunities for exploration and discovery beyond the confines of the main story missions.

Occasional Technical Issues: Like its predecessor, Freedom Cry is not without its technical hiccups. Players may encounter occasional bugs, glitches, or performance issues, which can detract from the overall experience and immersion.

In conclusion, Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry offers a compelling and immersive gaming experience that delves into the dark history of slavery in the Caribbean. With its gripping narrative, diverse setting, and meaningful gameplay, it stands as a worthy addition to the Assassin's Creed series. While it may suffer from some repetitive missions and technical issues, its powerful storytelling and social commentary make it a must-play for fans of the franchise and anyone interested in exploring this pivotal period in history.",1707462476,1707462476,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

154522484,"{'steamid': '76561198137026460', 'num_games_owned': 1255, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1703610889}",english,"[h1] [b] [i] Short but satisfying sub-chapter of Black Flag [/i] [/b] [/h1]

Freedom Cry is a second ""major"" standalone expansion released for the Assassin's Creed franchise (not  counting the Altair's side-games) when it was still in its prime. I went into it cautious as I was very lukewarm about the previous attempt at a large-scale standalone AC companion game, Liberation. I thought that despite its obvious qualities, its sheer mediocrity and drawn-out design did not justify its existence alongside the amazing AC 3. This is why I went into Freedom Cry with tempered expectations even in the light of its overwhelming praise from fans and I have to say - it's actually pretty decent for what it is.
[h1] [i] “A: I have killed many men on principle, but never have I wanted one to suffer as much as you - to understand what it is to gasp and beg for your life, like the innocents you drowned.
P: You mean those slaves? That ship? But they are not even human! Without the discipline and guidance of their masters, they turn to rebellion and murder, like you.
A: I only wish that were true.” [/i] [/h1]

Unlike in Liberation's case, I have never felt that Freedom Cry has overstayed its welcome. While Adewale's story arc is very reminiscent of that of Aveline (that being freeing slaves and showing them hope in the darkest of times), FC does not manufacture unnecessary story elements just for the sake of content inflation. It has its purpose and it goes about it swiftly and satisfyingly. You  can easily finish the main story in 3-4 hours if you run through it but I have actively wanted to do some of the side-activities which mainly consist of various ways in which you can free slaves around the mainland and adds as pleasant (and relevant story-wise) breaks between main missions.

Freedom Cry genuinely feels different from the game it is based on - AC IV Black Flag. Despite its small scope, it manages a complete shift in focus while integrating the best mechanics from the main game. The large-scale liberating of slaves is contrasting Edward's lust for power and gold and Adewale's playstyle feels different enough from him that it does not just feel like ""More of AC IV on a new map"".

If, after finishing Black Flag, you have not grown tired of the mechanics introduced there and want a short and sweet adventure that shows what Ade was up to after parting ways with Kenway.  It's by no means a revolutionary entry in the franchise (or even a revolutionary DLC) but its such a well-made compact package with perfect pacing where I would not mind going through it again, which is more than I can say for Liberation.
[h2] [b] [u] Positives & Negatives [/u] [/b] [/h2]
[table]
[tr]
[th][b] [i] Positives [/i] [/b][/th]
[th][b] [i] Negatives [/i] [/b][/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]+ Short enough to be enjoyable while not getting repetitive[/td]
[td]- The other main characters could have been more fleshed out and interesting[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]+ Adewale is an amazing character and the new added depth suits him[/td]
[td]- There could have been a few more main missions[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td]+ The best part is the difference between Adewale and Kenway's combat styles and the new additions in FC - the less elegant but more impactful machete replacing the dual sabres/swords and the absolute BEAST that is the blunderbuss [/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]+ New types of missions built around the game's primary story focus - freeing of slaves [/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]+ I love the addition of the tribal-themed soundtrack that plays into the game's theme [/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]

154461723,"{'steamid': '76561198220351609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1704207672}",turkish,bomba,1703606599,1703606599,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

154320508,"{'steamid': '76561199209058753', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1703448129}",schinese,"[h1]纯纯答辩[/h1]
dlc拿出来单卖，而且体量小的同时价格还高，甚至不如解放，再加上没有中文，育碧就值得这个差评。
[h1]再说下游戏内具体问题[/h1]
首先就是卡退问题，一个三小时的游戏体量，让我卡退了三次，平均一小时一次，育碧你可真行。

本作和暴君华盛顿很像，敌对单位警戒度十分敏感且多，一共没多大的地图，到处都是人，外加上能巡逻自动攻击的单位以及满地图的红色区域，逼着你玩无双信条，刚从俯瞰点跳下来就开始打。而且经常明明没有触发任何行为并且也不是警戒区域，士兵莫名其妙就开始攻击。最傻逼的一次是，街上没有人，我走的好好地，他妈的房顶上的单位就开始攻击地上的我，这部警戒度做的就是一坨。更恶心的是，这种情况经常会在过剧情的时候出现，导致任务或完全同步失败。
当然，本作无双程度同样媲美暴君华盛顿，或许测试的时候发现怪太多，加入了散弹枪，那个龙骑枪是个什么玩意，一喷几十个，尸体都能崩飞抽搐半天。也就暴君华盛顿里面的熊能与之抗衡。
说到龙骑枪，育碧你能不能别把奖励放在过完剧情才能获得，本来就是一个体量没多大的DLC，玩法重复度高且和黑棋一样，有多少人会在过完主线接着玩？而且我喜欢主线做到一半就把别的收集物全拿了，过完主线直接结束了，再给个武器有什么意义？

153972693,"{'steamid': '76561199352280877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1703045254}",brazilian,"Nesse jogo que na verdade é uma dlc do AC Black flag (comprei por burrice, pq ja tinha o black flag) você controla Adewale, que era o quartel-mestre do Edward no jogo principal, após ele se juntar aos assassinos.

A campanha é extremamente curta, basicamente vc ajuda na luta dos escravos em uma pequena cidade. Tem pequenas atividades como liberar escravos da prisão ou atacar navios negreiros, mas o jogo n te da muita motivação pra faze-las.
O cenario e gameplay são identicos ao Black Flag, obviamente.
Poderiam ter feito algo melhor com certeza, por exemplo a dlc do AC3 que é bem mais divertida.
Vc pode jogar mesmo sem ter passado pelo ACIV, vai te dar uma pequena experiencia de AC pelo preço de um pastel.

153298610,"{'steamid': '76561197984049950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1702321823}",german,"Zwei Dinge, die wichtig sind:
1) Ich musste die Steam Controller Unterstützung ausschalten, damit der Controller funktioniert.

Dazu macht in der Bibliothek einen Rechts-Klick auf ""Assassins's Creed Freedom Cry"" geht in dem Menü auf ""Einstellungen"" und dort auf ""Controller. Dort könnt ihr die Steam Unterstützung ausschalten und dann funktioniert der Controller auch.
2)  Wenn ihr einen Ultrawidescreen habt wird das Bild in jedem Fall verzerrt, egal welche Auflösung ihr wählt.
Ihr benötigt eine andere Exe. Diese könnt ihr hier runterladen:
https://steamcommunity.com/linkfilter/?u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsgfmedia.com%2Fjackfuste%2FAssassins%2520Creed%2520Freedom%2520Cry%2F21_9.7z
Benennt zuerst die alte Datei um und kopiert dann die neue in das Spiel-Verzeichnis.
Scheint bei mir erstmal zu laufen.

Der Launcher von Ubisoft ist die Hölle und die Unterstützung ebenso. Aber dieses Spiel ist den Aufwand wert, habe es auf der PS schon einmal durchgespielt und freue mich jetzt auf die schönere Grafik. :-)",1702216065,1702217026,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

152934024,"{'steamid': '76561198237156174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1701792798}",spanish,"Cosas buenas: La ambientación sigue siendo excelente, los personajes carismáticos y la historia refrescante.

152779158,"{'steamid': '76561198964093654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1701762894}",schinese,还可以,1701583746,1701583746,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

152709876,"{'steamid': '76561198798000950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1703496978}",tchinese,"100%同步全成就，滿分5給3分，《該作內容已經整合進四代內！》，刺客真愛粉才考慮再花一筆錢購買收藏，玩法就是四代的《黑旗》完全沒變，體量非常小，半天時間就能全成就+滿同步。
故事背景定位在黑人貿易時期，遭受殖民者迫害的黑皮人種們，該作主角就是《黑旗》主角的副手，本來以為會和愛德華一樣寫主角心理歷程，結果也只是淺淺一筆帶過直接進結局，雖說只是作為DLC形式，但也浪費了這麼好的黑人題材。",1701510448,1702930028,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

152617886,"{'steamid': '76561198864187987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1701528656}",schinese,"作为黑旗的DLC，流程很短而且任务剧情有限，自然是不推荐大家单独购买的，建议捆绑包入手。
太子港的海风唱响的是黑奴解放的赞歌
寓示着加勒比海的压迫和流血不复往日
正如伟大的大副阿德瓦勒拯救被困同胞后
深藏功与名 拂衣自离去的一句

152469749,"{'steamid': '76561198969770020', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1648131068}",schinese,"DLC的体量做成了一个单独的作品，育碧你别太想赚钱，还好我是等到了打折买的，你让那些原价买的人多心寒啊，我打完才花了5.5小时。

150560387,"{'steamid': '76561199111215903', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1700583096}",ukrainian,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry - DLC, яка стала самостійною грою на платформі Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag. Механіки залишились ті самі, але додали нові саундтреки. Багів, з невідомих причин, стало більше, хоч вони і не критичні. Гра дуже коротка, і на мою думку, це плюс. За короткий проміжок часу Адевале ще більше розкривається як особистість, його мотиви прості та їх легко зрозуміти. Присутні жорстокі сцени. Гра розрахована більше на фанатів серії; якщо це ваш перший Assassin's Creed, вона може здатися вам дивною.
Оцінка: 6/10
Ніщо не істина, все дозволено.⚔️🏹",1700589775,1700589775,True,3,0,0.563492059707641602,0,True,False,False,True,,,

149842652,"{'steamid': '76561199149872796', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 390, 'playtime_forever': 6556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1699932251}",schinese,"8/10 他是个传奇，倒在另一个传奇的脚下，也不失这传奇之名。
（仅）主线通关感言
我对刺客信条系列的游玩过程是反向来的，让我认识黑叔叔的，不是源自黑旗，而是反叛。
我很惊喜黑叔叔居然有过这样的人生，为了黑人的自由不懈奋斗。
但是这一作中同样发现了他性格上的缺点，冲动，不择手段，可能就是谢伊与他为敌，与兄弟会为敌的原因吧。。。
黑叔叔应该是刺客信条这部作品中，最没有存在感，最平凡的刺客之一了吧！
我在这里替谢伊说一声，“对不起！”",1699578973,1699578973,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

145660561,"{'steamid': '76561198213387671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1693842267}",ukrainian,"Потрясающе продолжение черного флага хоть и достаточно короткое прошел игру на 100% буквально за 6 часов ничего не осталось что можно было бы поделать или же как нибудь продлить нахождение в игре но есть один нюанс невозможность пройти сюжет когда захочешь каждый раз вылезает уведомление спаси 20 рабов спаси 90 рабов это немного напрягает но за это ты можешь економить на боеприпасах и снаряжении после дэтого как я спас 400 рабов у меня стало совершенно все бесплатным по этому под конец я скопил приблизительно 100.000 кроме прокачки коробля их некуда было трать из-за это возникает вопрос а зачем было это добовлять хотя это и считается длс которое сделали отдельной игрой но все же обесценивание валюты немного расстроило, так же стоит отметить пирацкие песни это громадный минус который портит всю атмосферу если вам не хватило черного флага с его обордажами и карибским морем к покупке рекомендую но за пирацкие песни -бал 9/10",1693842781,1693842781,True,1,0,0.523809552192687988,0,True,False,False,True,,,

145566316,"{'steamid': '76561198111514014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1693710088}",brazilian,"[h1]Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry[/h1]
Um puta jogo, mas vamos la...
[h1]Pontos Positivos[/h1]
* Jogabilidade: Ótima!

* Historia: Legal. Pra mim o game nem tem uma historia, mas sim um contexto. Você é um Assassino, ex-escravo, que acaba se deparando com o comercio e maus tratos e toma a decisão de agir. Acho sensacional e deveria ter um game completo como uma historia sobre rebelião de escravos ou algo relacionado, expansão curta.
* Combate de navios: Muito Foda!
[h1]Pontos Negativos[/h1]

* Save: Olha, eu sei que o jogo é curto porque vi as reviews, mas não zerei. joguei um pouco mais de 5 horas e fiz 60% do game. hoje abri o jogo e não tem save. Como se eu nunca tivesse jogado. E não tem save manual.

[i]Resumindo a opera, eu zerei? Não! Fiz review como um alerta! O jogo é bom? Sim! Pra caralho! Vale a pena? Ai cabe a você. Talvez eu ainda tente zera esse jogo algum dia, mas por agora eu desisti. Cabe a você tomar a decisão de arriscar ou não. Se você conseguir ele barato em uma promoção, talvez valha a pena arriscar, mas cabe a você a decisão.[/i]",1693711418,1693711481,False,2,0,0.523809552192687988,0,True,False,False,True,,,

143710411,"{'steamid': '76561199064138444', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 1077, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1695405489}",russian,"Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry - это дополнение к популярной серии игр Assassin's Creed, разработанной компанией Ubisoft. Оно было выпущено в 2014 году и является самостоятельным дополнением к Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag. Сюжет игры раскрывает события, происходящие после основной игры, и фокусируется на новом главном герое, Адевале, бывшем рабе, который стал Ассасином и борется за свободу.
Геймплей:

Freedom Cry сохраняет основные элементы геймплея из Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, такие как морские бои и паркур, но также добавляет новые механики и задания, связанные с борьбой за освобождение рабов и борьбой с работорговцами. Игроку предоставляется свобода выбора в выполнении заданий и использовании оружия. Стоит отметить, что игра короткая по сравнению с полноценными частями серии Assassin's Creed, но это обусловлено её статусом дополнения.
Сюжет:

События Freedom Cry разворачиваются в Гаване, на Гаити и вокруг них. Главный герой, Адевале, был введен в Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag как важный персонаж и квартмейстер на корабле. В Freedom Cry он отправляется в Гавану, где сталкивается с ужасами работорговли и решает примкнуть к Ассасинам, чтобы бороться с этим злом. Сюжет обращает внимание на тему рабства и нарушений прав человека, что придает игре более серьезный и глубокий характер.
Графика и звук:

Игра использует ту же графическую основу, что и Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, что позволяет сохранить высокое качество визуального исполнения. Дизайн окружающего мира и персонажей достаточно детализирован, что позволяет игрокам глубже погрузиться в атмосферу Карибского бассейна XVIII века. Звуковое сопровождение также создает аутентичную атмосферу времени и места.
Заключение:

Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry - это увлекательное дополнение к Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, которое обогащает мир серии новыми персонажами, сюжетом и темами. Оно обращает внимание на важные вопросы рабства и освобождения, придавая игре более серьезный характер. Однако из-за своей короткой продолжительности и структуры дополнения, игра может не предложить такой же глубокой и насыщенной опыт, как полноценные части основной серии. Тем не менее, если вы являетесь поклонником Assassin's Creed или интересуетесь темами свободы и борьбы за справедливость, Freedom Cry может быть интересным опытом.
Как и у любой игры, у Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry есть свои минусы, которые могут повлиять на общее восприятие игроков. Вот некоторые из них:

Короткая продолжительность: Freedom Cry является самостоятельным дополнением и, следовательно, имеет более ограниченную продолжительность по сравнению с полноценными частями основной серии Assassin's Creed. Игроки, ожидающие такого же глубокого и продолжительного опыта, могут остаться недовольными.

Ограниченные инновации: Дополнение в значительной степени опирается на механики и игровые элементы, представленные в Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag. Это может вызвать ощущение недостатка в новых инновациях и механиках, которые можно было бы внести в игровой процесс.

Ограниченное разнообразие заданий: В игре есть некоторое разнообразие миссий и заданий, но оно может показаться несколько ограниченным по сравнению с полноценными частями Assassin's Creed. Это может вызвать чувство повторения и монотонности в ходе прохождения.

Ограниченное использование морских битв: Морские бои были одним из выдающихся элементов Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, но в Freedom Cry они играют менее важную роль. Это может разочаровать игроков, ожидавших большего взаимодействия с морскими аспектами геймплея.

Заглушенность персонажа Адевале: Адевале, главный герой Freedom Cry, является интересной фигурой, но его характер может показаться менее выразительным и меньше разнообразным по сравнению с некоторыми другими персонажами в серии Assassin's Creed.

Узкая фокусировка на тему: Тема рабства и борьбы за свободу является важной частью сюжета Freedom Cry, но она может быть слишком узкой для некоторых игроков. Это может вызвать разногласия в плане интереса и вовлеченности в сюжетную линию.

Технические проблемы: Как и многие игры, Freedom Cry также может иметь некоторые технические проблемы, такие как баги, снижение производительности и другие неполадки. Это может влиять на общее удовольствие от игры.

В целом, Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry предлагает интересное продолжение мира Assassin's Creed, но оно имеет свои ограничения и минусы. Несмотря на них, игра может быть привлекательной для поклонников серии и тех, кто интересуется историческими и социальными темами, поднятыми в игре.

В игре Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, Адевале был важным персонажем в команде Эдварда Кенуэя и служил квартмейстером на корабле ""Джекдо"". Однако в дополнении Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry история Адевале развивается дальше, объясняя, почему он решил уйти от Эдварда и почему он стал Ассасином.

События Freedom Cry происходят после основной игры. Адевале спасается после кораблекрушения и оказывается на Гаити, где сталкивается с ужасами работорговли. Он видит страдания рабов и решает присоединиться к борьбе за их свободу, основав свою собственную борьбу против рабовладельцев и торговцев.

Поэтому Адевале решает отойти от Эдварда и его пиратской жизни, чтобы бороться за более высокие ценности - свободу и справедливость. Этот выбор также связан с этическими убеждениями Адевале и его желанием исправить ошибки прошлого, особенно в контексте рабства, которое он сам пережил.

Таким образом, решение Адевале уйти от Эдварда отражает его личную эволюцию и стремление к более глубокому смыслу в своей жизни, а не просто оставаться пиратом и искать богатство.",1691579829,1691579829,True,1,0,0.342391312122344971,0,True,False,False,True,,,

143392587,{'steamid': '76561198834977911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1090, 'last_played': 1691159776}",french,Very nice,1691160319,1691160319,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

143337919,"{'steamid': '76561198111154003', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1691078605}",english,"This should stay as DLC for Black Flag. [b]Freedom Cry[/b] is good. To put it simple - it's like Black Flag but somebody compressed it.
The whole game can be done in 7h and we're talking about 100% it.

Let's just talk about Freedom Cry as a game as the devs wants it to be. It has its own identity (though still doesn't feel like Assassin's Creed game). The music give off African vibe, keeping that: ""you were a slave too"" thought in your head and making you wanna help as many people as you can.

Which is related to progression too. In any other AC game, you buy your new toys. In Freedom Cry though.... the more slaves you set free, the more equipment you unlock. It’s a great idea but makes money kinda useless (you use it on ship mostly since one of upgrades from slaves lets you get ammo for free). I feel sailing got pushed back into background. There is not much to explore and missions rather rarely take you out in the open. What made me sad the most is the fact your crew don’t sing while sailing. Yea… it’s a small thing but still it was better to have that.

Let’s talk about weapons Ade uses. Most of them are the same as in Black Flag but he has machete instead two swords, blunderbuss instead of pistols and as an extra firecrackers. That may not seem like much but gives a much more options to complete missions.

The only downside of AC Freedom Cry is the story. It’s written really well but it’s way too short. It’s hard to get to know and like all characters. And since the game’s this short, Ade’s internal change feels way too rushed and kinda hard to believe.
It’s a great addition to Assassin’s Creed series and I recommend to try it. It’s worth it",1691084850,1691084850,True,14,0,0.671404004096984863,0,True,False,False,True,,,

143241160,"{'steamid': '76561198982430028', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1690957366}",spanish,"Un DLC sobre nuestro querido Adewalé, su unico defecto es que fue pensado como DLC por lo tanto es corto, se presentó como juego individual aqui pero merecía ser un juego completo con una historia mas extensa y más escenarios. Es lo único que me apena, en lo demás es perfecto. Muy facil quizas, demasiado por la misma razón, pero la historia sigue la madurez de una historia centrada en su protagonista, como lo es Black Flag sobre Edward. Algo que lamentablemente se ha perdido en la saga, en esta epoca los personajes eran construidos dentro de la trama del juego, tenían una identidad.",1690949609,1690949670,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

142641318,"{'steamid': '76561198060469849', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1690115641}",english,"Freedom Cry is pretty much Black Flag, but extremely short. 142631136,"{'steamid': '76561199093411560', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1683980028}",english,"One of the few times I've actually felt for NPCs and hated the villains all the more because of it. 142283945,"{'steamid': '76561198346338021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1689619614}",spanish,"Es mas un DLC de Black Flag y un simulador de liberar esclavos, tampoco es un gran aporte en la historia por eso lo dejo como mas un DLC pero puedes perfectamente no jugarlo.",1689619720,1689619720,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

142271157,"{'steamid': '76561199110644696', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 2199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1689789648}",russian,"Прежде всего, хотелось бы предоставить краткую информацию об этой игре. ""Freedom Cry"" изначально была сюжетным дополнением к ""Assassin’s Creed IV: Black Flag"", входящей в состав Season Pass, а позже перенесена в отдельную игру.
Большинство считает, что это просто трехчасовое приключение старпома Эдварда, но на самом деле тут не все так просто.

Во-первых, существует сильная сюжетная связь между третьей частью, ""Черным флагом"", ""Криком свободы"" и ""Изгоем"". И история Адевале дает понять, что стало с чернокожим другом и помощником главного героя из основной игры и его кораблем до событий, связанных с Шеем Кормаком.

Адевале стал ассассином, а его целью было освобождение рабов. Действие игры разворачивается на острове Гаити, у берегов которого корабль ""Галка"" потерпел крушение. Став капитаном нового судна ""Эксперто Креде"" он решил помочь местным рабам. К сожалению, больше событий в три часа геймплея разработчикам вместить не удалось.

Во-вторых, тут довольно много нового контента, в отличие от, например, сюжетных дополнений для ""Теней Мордора"". Это новая территория, новый герой с новым вооружением и новой анимацией боя, а также новые элементы геймплея. Основным оружием Адевале является мачете и мушкетон, что уже сильно отличается от двух мечей и пистолетов Эдварда.

В целом, это шикарное дополнение, которое очень кстати вынесли в отдельную игру, так как в этом случае ее можно объединить в трилогию вместе с ""Черным флагом"" и ""Изгоем"". Или в тетралогию, если учитывать третью часть. Кроме того, я считаю, что ознакомиться с ""Криком свободы"" можно и обойдя стороной основную игру. Но покупать его рекомендую только по скидке, так как оно включено в сезонный пропуск.",1689605851,1689605851,True,3,0,0.53049314022064209,2,True,False,False,True,,,

141779494,"{'steamid': '76561199219174224', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1690944805}",english,mmm,1689015726,1689015726,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

141770422,"{'steamid': '76561198927342826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1689159104}",english,"So, I have a lot of issues with this game.  First, the gameplay itself:  I find the combat more janky than in Black Flag and I'm not sure if it's that they just remapped Edward's combat to a bigger body and it doesn't fit quite right or what. I hate that when you die, it takes away all of the progress you made. The previous games leading up to this didn't do that, so you can spend 20 minutes stealthing your way through a mission, meeting all of the objectives, and if you fall off a roof you lose every bit of that progress you have made. I've finished a mission several times now thinking I did all of the objectives only to realize it erased something I did because I got desynchronized at some point. Very frustrating.

Next, the overall story:  It's boring. Ade seems to be narrowed down to a single dimension and the story also seems very one-dimensional. I understand that this is a DLC-type mini-game, but it's still just really lacking.  The fact that the entire game seems to just be around 'free slaves' is one-dimensional in and of itself, but you don't even get the satisfaction of clearing a space for good and getting to be like 'ah yes, I did it, I freed all of the slaves in this area' because they respawn! Quickly! And, if you are a little too empathetic like me, you get tired of constantly going through the same motions so you have to ignore the slaves being auctioned and beaten and killed around you to progress the game and then you feel shitty every time you walk past one of these scenes which is ALL THE TIME. And that leads me to my personal biggest issue with this game...

It seems pretty racist. Now, hear me out. On its surface, it's fine. Former slave goes on a mission to ""liberate"" as many other slaves as he can by hacking his way through slave owners, yay! But when you look at it more closely, there are a lot of issues. For one, Ade himself. Aveline was a fully fleshed character with her own story who also had a history with slavery, dealt with racism, and freed slaves. Ade seems to have one sole goal, despite the fact that he should be a fully fleshed character with his own story and his own goals. Why wasn't Edward singularly obsessed with freeing slaves? Ah, because he wasn't black?  It seems like the game designers don't know what to do with a black protagonist other than center their story around slavery, which shows a lack of thinking of black people as whole people. Also, perhaps most egregious, slaves are LITERAL CURRENCY in the game. You have to get enough of them to unlock upgrades. I'm not sure why no one along the development and editing process thought 'hmm, maybe we shouldn't use a tally of black people as a currency' but they didn't.

I just think they went so heavy-handed with ""anti-slavery"" that they didn't stop to think about the fact that us black people aren't able to be reduced to one thing and that there is far more to our history as people, but also to us as *individuals* than slavery. Very frustrating that the white (and half-white, and Aveline's story was half about slavery so...) characters get to be fully fleshed individuals and the black ones get to be... anti-slavery. :/",1689007150,1689007150,False,6,4,0.525670170783996582,0,True,False,False,True,,,

141668505,"{'steamid': '76561198008376294', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 501, 'playtime_forever': 111369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1697086411}",english,"A self-contained tale about the human catastrophe of slavery is an abrupt turn from the original’s happy-go-lucky plundering style, but the game’s mechanics adapt relatively well.",1688897073,1688897073,True,1,0,0.525862038135528564,0,True,False,False,True,,,

141478222,"{'steamid': '76561198201049295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1692375082}",english,"I bought this game on sale so it didn't cost much, but after about 11 hours of gameplay and a random update it kept asking for the activation code only to say that it was ""already activated"" and the game could no longer start. I contacted Ubisoft support but they could not fix it even after a lot of communication and eventually they stopped answering. Sucks that it ended up that way since the game seemed awesome when I could play it. It's annoying that it suddenly no longer worked. (also, trying to start the game without actually managing to start it added on another hour to my ""gameplay time""...)

I would like to add (way later now and I replayed it at a friends house on Ps... Turns out I already completed it on my computer before it crashed, I just missed a cut-scene and couldn't 100% it), that the game is really awesome. I personally loved Black flag so this, as a DLC or a standalone game, is brilliant. I only chose not to recommend it because of the error I received which seemed to be on Ubisofts side, not Steam. They somehow couldn't communicate and the problem never got fixed, which is extremely annoying. I WOULD recommend the game, just maybe on a console before steam since Steam and Ubisoft had problems with communication and I wouldn't wish that on someone else for full price.",1688678248,1704712872,False,1,0,0.52173912525177002,0,True,False,False,True,,,

140384018,"{'steamid': '76561198000878931', 'num_games_owned': 1177, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1687183142}",english,"A much shorter experience but well worth the look. You play as Adéwalé your assassins creed 4 former ship mate for kenway.Theres not much new here in terms of gameplay in face a lot of the exploring is gone. You have your collectathon stuff here but it's mostly just treasures.

What is new is saving slaves from around the map. The more slaves you save that more things you unlock which gives you the incentive to save them. You save them by doing various things such as killing guards before they get caught. Finding a key and rescuing them from cages and save them from being beaten before they die.

You get more of a backstory for Adéwalé here if you are interested in that sort of thing and the game can be beaten in one sitting so if that interests you then this is worth your time.",1687263746,1687263746,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

137245188,"{'steamid': '76561198089811858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1682438638}",german,geht nicht habs runtergeladen,1682370186,1682370186,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

136990019,"{'steamid': '76561198150740168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1681955934}",brazilian,"É o AC4 com praticamente nada pra se fazer.

Uma DLC extremamente curta, tanto de duração quanto de conteúdo novo. As únicas novidades são a machete, bacamarte (ambas armas muito divertidas) e a libertação de escravos. Os eventos envolvendo escravos são fixos em certas áreas do mapa e se repetem infinitamente sem nenhuma mudança.
O mapa é minúsculo, tendo só 1 cidade pequena.
A história é boa, considerando o tempo de jogo, principalmente por conta do Adéwalé que é um dos melhores personagens do Black Flag e o melhor personagem no Freedom Cry.
O combate e parkour são bons e divertidos.
Durante as abordagens navais o combate fica muito bugado, em certos momentos atrapalhando a gameplay. Isso acontecia as vezes no AC4, mas nessa DLC esse problema é frequente.

Recomendo o jogo, mesmo sendo curto é divertido. A platina é fácil e não incomoda, mas é repetitiva. Não compre sem um desconto grande, eu comprei por uns 14 reais e ainda sim foi muito caro. Aparentemente a DLC vem inclusa com o AC4 Gold edition, o que vale muito mais à pena. Só comprei essa versão separada porque a Ubi me deu a versão base do Black Flag de graça.",1681968545,1681968811,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

136456384,"{'steamid': '76561199045768715', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1681109919}",english,"Assassin's Creed: Freedom Cry is short, but sweet.

The main story only takes 4 hours to complete, throw in the rest of the optional content and it's still only 6-7 hours. It's pretty much a mini AC4: Black Flag. Smaller version of the Caribbean, shorter story, less character development, etc.
I really enjoyed it though! It does have a better moral code than AC4, and the story however short is quite lovely. Wasn't a huge fan of the side characters but Adewale carries, and I'm good with it.
Overall, a 6.5/10, would consider recommending.
TL;DR: It's a mini Black Flag that's still fairly enjoyable.",1681110352,1681258650,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

135415444,"{'steamid': '76561198874855396', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1698086610}",turkish,güzel oyun ama bu kadar paraya değmez,1679770113,1679770113,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

135359697,"{'steamid': '76561198123226540', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1679712642}",brazilian,"A é interessante, mas mal executada. Gosto demais da franquia, mas esse não recomendo, é mal otimizado, tem muitas quedas de FPS para a casa dos 50 e 40, independente do computador. As missões são extremamente repetitivas, tanto as primárias quanto as secundárias. Essa ideia de libertar escravos é bem legal, mas a realizaram de uma forma muito ruim, tendo em vista que exageraram nesse aspecto e você é obrigado a ficar libertando escravos o tempo todo de uma maneira demasiadamente repetitiva, fazendo assim a gameplay ficar muito repetida e chata. O mapa é minúsculo e mesmo assim, a história se passa praticamente toda em Porto Príncipe. Várias ilhas com apenas um baú para coletar. A IA da tripulação é muito ruim, o tempo todo eles me atrapalharam nas batalhas de invasão de navios. Missões bugadas. Poucos upgrades de navio, sem sistema de craft, apenas uma roupa para o personagem. Percebe-se nitidamente que foi feito as pressas e sem o menor zelo. É a mais fraca campanha que joguei dessa franquia, tiveram uma boa ideia de temática sobre a escravidão, mas não souberam aproveitar. Não vale os 45,00 cascalhos que estão cobrando.",1679716080,1679716080,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

130934727,"{'steamid': '76561198017962331', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1673820411}",french,"Suite directe des aventures de Black Flag, ce chapitre nous porte dans la colonie Française de Port au Prince en compagnie d'Adawalé. Ce dernier à soif de liberté et s'insurge devant l'oppression des esclaves des plantations Française !

A l'aide de l'Experto Crede, le navire d'Adewalé, d'une machette que l'on peut amélioré en explorant les environs de Port au Prince, du Tromblon fusil à chevrotine qui vient remplacer les pistolets pirates, nous allons faire souffler un vent de liberté dans les colonies !
Une suite avec le même gameplay, la libération d’esclaves et de résistants apporte des bonus.

Une 10aine d'heures pour compléter les 9 chapitres et explorer les lieux, c'est un réel plaisir de poursuivre l'aventure dans les caraïbes !",1673820769,1673821527,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

130857038,"{'steamid': '76561198967148194', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1672947637}",russian,"[h1] Предисловие [/h1]

Игроки Black Flag уже встречались с главным героем Freedom Cry, Адевале. Дополнение разворачивается спустя годы после событий Black Flag, но не упоминает их, за исключением случайного упоминания главного героя игры, Эдварда Кенуэя. Адевале, ныне активный член Братства ассасинов, перехватывает посылку тамплиеров. Природа разрывает его корабль на части, и он просыпается на берегу Порт-о-Пренса. Рабство упоминалось в «Черном флаге», но оно занимает центральное место в экономике Порт-о-Пренса и ближающих островов. Адевале участвует в пивоваренной революции, обещая помощь, прежде чем вернуться к ассасинам.

Несмотря на то, что Black Flag представлял собой долгожданное возвращение к форме для серии, которая почти стала неактуальной после своей третьей удачной части, было так много всего, что нужно было изменить.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2918088577

Однако в Freedom Cry изменился контекст ваших действий. Непрекращающееся, по большей части утомительное перетягивание каната между ассасинами и тамплиерами — всего лишь показуха в Freedom Cry, а главной мотивацией Адевале является желание освободить своих братьев от оков, в которых он когда-то оказался. от темы рабства. Это мучительно, лично и глубоко эмоционально. Несмотря на то, что серия Assassin's Creed основана на фантастической предпосылке, нельзя ссылаться на очень реальную концепцию рабства без тщательного изучения. И здесь Freedom Cry одновременно взлетает и падает.
[h1] Доп.Задания [/h1]

У меня никогда не возникало желания выполнять дополнительные задачи в Assassin's Creed. Это функция для завершителей, и, похоже, она поощряла поведение игроков, которое выдвигало на первый план самые худшие части игрового процесса Assassin's Creed. Но я часто ловил себя на том, что пытаюсь сделать все в Freedom Cry. Одно дело попросить игрока попытаться убить цель с воздуха, и совсем другое — попросить его спасти группу рабов на территории, которую вы исследуете. Это вымышленный опыт, но это мощная ниточка, за которую нужно дергать. Дело не в том, что Freedom Cry полностью заново изобретает часто скучные цели, которыми руководствуются миссии в Assassin's Creed, но контекстуальное переосмысление придает им мощный эмоциональный компонент.
Но есть и причины, чтобы поднять бровь.
[h1] Спасение рабов [/h1]

Спасение рабов — одно из ключевых дополнений игрового процесса Freedom Cry, и вам постоянно напоминают, как вы можете помочь. Раб может пытаться сбежать от своего похитителя, и вы можете остановить погоню. Другая группа рабов может находиться в процессе продажи, и вы можете вмешаться, купить их и освободить. Некоторые из них могут присоединиться к разжиганию революции в Порт-о-Пренсе, а другим просто позволено жить своей жизнью. В этом есть смысл, и с точки зрения разработки полноценного открытого мира это дает игроку регулярные, значимые действия, в которых он может участвовать, переходя к следующей миссии. Что вызывает сомнения, так это решение Ubisoft превратить рабов в форму внутриигровой валюты. Чем больше рабов освобождает игрок, тем больше обновлений доступно от поставщиков, поддерживающих Адевале. Это включает в себя спасение невольничьих кораблей, на которых одновременно может разместиться около 100 пленников. В игре уже есть внутриигровая валюта, которую игрок использует для покупки вещей, поэтому понятно, что дизайнеры Ubisoft хотели вознаграждать игроков за участие в побочных задачах, но это только подрывает серьезность, с которой игра иначе относится к этому предмету. И есть настоящие моменты эмоционального разбитого сердца, когда все эти концентрируются.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2918088135

Особенно трудный момент заключается в том, что Адевале игнорирует рекомендации своих товарищей-революционеров и пытается освободить ближайший корабль с рабами. Все идет ужасно, ужасно неправильно и в полной мере демонстрирует ядовитое, бесчеловечное презрение жестоких правителей Порт-о-Пренса. Когда вы не можете спасти всех, кого вы спасаете? Это момент, когда Freedom Cry пронзительно наслаивает зрелище, возможное только в высокобюджетной видеоигре, с тонкостью, которую мы привыкли ожидать от наших лучших независимых продуктов. В одном разделе Адевале карабкается по стене, как это часто делает персонаж из Assassin's Creed, но то, что вас окружает... незабываемо.
[h1] Итог [/h1]

Freedom Cry — это надежда. Речь идет о надежде для людей, даже если она кажется тщетной и мимолетной. Вы не решаете проблему рабства в Freedom Cry. То, как рабы и владельцы плантаций постоянно возвращаются в мир, независимо от того, сколько вы освобождаете, также является подлинным комментарием к состоянию рабства в то время. Возможно, это просто способ, которым игра не дает миру опустеть... но это работает. Надстройка также дает надежду на то, что возможно, когда создатели блокбастеров рискуют с материалом. В Freedom Cry есть оплошности, скорее этичные, чем механические, но она попадает так же часто, как и промахивается. Это, несомненно, важный шаг вперед.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2918088363",1673730957,1673731018,True,3,0,0.562218070030212402,0,True,False,False,True,,,

130264029,"{'steamid': '76561198315190622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1618598886}",russian,чисто ради повески сделана и внимания не стоит от слова вообще,1673006952,1673006952,False,0,0,0.47486037015914917,0,True,False,False,True,,,

130256424,"{'steamid': '76561198973888834', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1672994369}",english,"Being only 4 hours long, this game was a blast to play through. A very short and sweet story with very few follow missions thank god. Not throwing stealth away completely, this game trades up stealth for some head on action sequences.
Weapons in Freedom Cry are different as they got rid of swords and daggers. You get machetes for Adéwalé instead. (This does not prevent you from picking up and using a sword from a slain enemy.)
No flintlock pistols, just a blunderbuss for you, Adé.
You still have your own pair of Hidden Blades of course.

Much of the in game assets were from Black Flag so the graphics are more or less the same. Game-play wise as well, but again more action than stealth really. And his attack animations, though not as fluid or graceful as i expected assassins would be, he has a sort of brutal flair that really defines him as an assassin. Not just Edward Kenway re-skinned to be Adéwalé.

Although I don't agree with the price point of $22.95 AUD due to everything being ""small scale"" compared to Black Flag, I do however highly recommend getting this on sale and absorbing yourself for 4 to 5 hours. Get it however you can as it is a very good game and you won't really regret playing it.

All in all the story has a very noble cause, Adéwalé's mission to liberate the slaves of Port-au-Prince while attempting to spark a revolution is engrossing. For a DLC turned standalone game, it has a lot more content than one would expect. Honestly i thought it was just gonna be a bunch of uninspired self contained missions, but this totally blew me away. It's extremely hard to find a con other than the length. Because of that there isn't much to complain about.
7.5/10 This is exactly what you expect from a DLC. If only present Ubisoft could learn from their past.

129401448,"{'steamid': '76561199124359538', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1672925260}",schinese,"关于对中国的友好建议

那些坑完小学生钱就走的游戏遍网全是，你不去整治；那些点开网页全是蹩脚普通话的游戏，你不去整治；那些官网买外挂的游戏，你不去整治。你整治3A大作？暴力？色情？你看看国内到处网页广告上的图，个个都比STEAM裸露，你管都不管，你来管STEAM。你有闲情雅致怎么不去管管中国影视业？发展的比卢本伟还畸形。看看你的CCAV，在看看别人的BBC，差距。你自己建立起来的文化自信又被你自己踩下去，为什么？不革新自身的管理方式，还拖一个大平台下水。STEAM虽然被很多中国玩家当成启动器，但好歹让大家有了正版意识这个观念，好不容易有点进展就要被打回原型，鼓励大家玩盗版？不说所谓民主，为什么不能分级，分级制度就能解决大部分事情，你这样有意思吗？你们这些专家是真的睿智啊。你天天弄这些没有用，干脆就直接把网络什么的都取消，正常人不让用得了，一天组织点什么喊口号种地？？？还是直接回归原始社会得了，

我真正在意的是如果我买的游戏玩不了，我又找谁来赔偿，完美，还是国家？不过估计最后就是让我们这些坚持正版的玩家白白损失一笔，最后有要被一些现实生活中的盗版优越大爷好好嘲讽一下了，睿智啊。厉害了我的国，呵呵。始皇帝啊，这盛世如你所愿。一些人和身边的朋友小时候就在传奇和cs的游戏中长大，也没有谁去砍人杀人犯法，现在的熊孩子看喜羊羊等把其他孩子烤了，到底是游戏动漫的错？还是家庭学校不负责任的教育的错？大家心里都有数.你就这样就脱离了坚持社会主义100年的目标了？中国梦，是什么？好好学习，肉身出墙

游戏属于第九文化，任何一款大作游戏，本身就蕴含着作者思想与道，但对于我国目前还未开放的价值观而言，外国对于未来的思考以及奇特的众多幻想是不能被广电局所接受的。国内游戏就目前而言，有steam和主机各方面的因素，依旧是做个垃圾就能赚的盆满钵满，他们知道游戏本身品质只要勉强过得去，在在游戏里面设计点能装X的“微操”，以及各种各样涩情的原画，各种各样中二的建模和台词就能骗到钱，游戏本身剧情一定要扯，不能有深度，浅显易懂。这样的制作反而比你认认真真想剧情做出来的游戏赚钱得多，steam在国内看起来很多人知道，实际上在绝地求生出来之前你走在大街上根本没几个人知道有steam这个东西
其实中国实名认证已经比国外领先了，银联支付和微信支付都必须得需要身份证，那为什么还迟迟不推出分级政策呢？因为现在是否过审文化部和广电总局是由最高决定权的，没有相关的法律和规定来决定一款游戏是否过审
以前有个国内单机游戏厂商制作了一款武侠游戏去送审，因为是国内厂商，所以对于审查机制是很了解的，在送审前就去掉了血液还有断肢效果，尸体也都变成了黑色的，可就是这样都无法过审，审查机构说这款游戏里的玩家扮演角色在杀人后坐牢十天就可以了，很容易造成一些不好的社会影响，后来改着改着就变成一款只能骑马的武侠游戏了
而腾讯的天涯明月刀在杀死人形敌人之后一点责任都不用负，继续屠杀就可以了，这样造成的社会影响是不是更大呢，可天涯明月刀却过审了
为什么会这样呢，腾讯日进斗金，它交得起钱，而那个小厂商做完游戏就没什么钱了，所以中国单机游戏的发展不是看你制作水平，也不是看你宣传到不到位，是先看你交不交得起钱
而中国相关部门在审查时声称依据是什么呢？就是社会所谓的主旋律，就是社会主义核心价值观
这有点像什么呢？古代君王都会给自己的权力找个合乎于法理的声明，君权神授，我是真龙天子，我的权利都是上天赐给我的，而社会主义核心价值观就是充当了这种用途的工具，给自己不正当不合乎于法理的权利和获得的利益一个看上去合理的声明
香港澳门是特别行政区（这里修改一下，台湾不属于地区），他们的社会经济政治文化制度都和大陆不一样，那大家想过为什么会这样吗，其实很简单，回哭的孩子有奶吃，就比如说香港，假如97回归的时候就是大陆制度的话，他们就会大罢工大罢学，让社会不能正常运转，而当时国内外也有很多双眼睛在看着香港，所以他们就是特别行政区
而咱们大陆人呢，封外网的时候，咱们忍受住了，和谐魔兽世界的时候又忍受住了，从来没有为自己的权益发过声，而现在变本加厉，Steam中国版都要出了，最好的结果都是出来个中国版商店，现有国区的支付方式及低价区优惠都转移到上面去，这次还默默忍受的话这次那以后呢，怕不是变成朝鲜光明网了吧

很多人都把这些事情看似是理所应当的，不管是封外网还是和谐游戏，暴走大事件或者是现在的Steam中国版，而事实呢，欧洲在INS啊twitter啊上面有恐怖分子活动，而他们是简简单单的墙了这些社交软件了吗，他们跟这些恐怖分子打网络战，把他们驱逐出了这些社交软件，那既然如此中共为什么不行，就因为墙了低成本吗，我们的权益及我们娱乐休闲的地方还不如打场网络战的成本吗，中国人就要就要妥协隐忍而外国人就能保障自己的权益吗
请大家把这些言论扩散出去

128792650,"{'steamid': '76561198838199040', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1594749315}",turkish,"! Spoiler !
[b]Adéwalé[/b]: Suikastçı olduğumda [b]korsanlığı[/b] arkamda bırakacağıma dair yemin ettim ama eski yöntemlerin de inanca çok hizmet ettiği bir aşikar.
[i]Bastienne Josèphe[/i]: [b]Bir kölenin damgasına bir alimin diline sahipsin... bir denizcinin ellerine... ve bir de Suikastçı başlığına.Birkaç silaha da.[/b]
Adéwalé: [b]Kendim için kazanamayacağım hiçbir şeye ihtiyacım yok.[/b]
Augustin Dieufort:
([b]İnsanlar yapmadan söyler, Tanrı söylemeden yapar [/b].)
[b] Kuş yuvasını adım adım kurar [/b].
[b] Adéwalé[/b]:
İnsan ticareti kazançlı iştir. Bir zamanlar eğitimli adamların yaptıklarını görmelerini umuyordum.Ama kazanç onları cahilleştiriyor.
[b] Sadece Suikastçılar bana gerçek otoriteyi teklif etti[/b].
Sözüm ''belkilerle'' ayakta duruyor.
... [b]Çok yakında zeki olan herkese güvenmenin tam anlamıyla bir aptallık olduğunu anlayacaksın.[/b]
İtiraf etmeliyim ki bir deniz adamı olarak navigasyon bilimi ilgimi çekiyor.
[i] Bastienne Josèphe[/i]:
[b]Her şeyin bir dengesi vardır Adéwalé[/b]. Bağımsızlığı elde etmek için Yerlilere [b]istikrar, anonimlik ve bilgi[/b] gerekli. Bu her zaman benim rolüm olmuştur.
Her şey [b] Saint Domingue (''Yerlileri'')[/b] için.
[b] Adéwalé [/b]:
[b]Kara bayrak. İliklerine kadar harcanacaklar. [/b]
Eğer bir serdümen, serdümen olarak kalmak istiyorsa, aklından geçenleri kendine saklaması akıllıca olacaktır. Suikastçılar bana daha ciddi hedefler için fırsat sunduklarında yağmayı geride bıraktım.
[b]Korsanlık [/b] yıllarımı hiçbir şeye değişmem. Bugün yaptığımız iş için beni [b]sertleştirdiler[/b]. Ve işim bittiğinde, eğitimin için [b]Korsanlara[/b] da teşekkür edeceksin.
Augustin: [b]İntikam soğuk bir teselliden ibaret[/b].
[b]Adéwalé: Prensipte bir çok adamı öldürdüm. ama asla boğmuş olduğun masumlar gibi hayatın için nefes nefese yalvarmasını ve senin kadar acı çekmesini istemedim.[/b]
Pierre, Marquis de Fayet: O köleleri mi kastediyorsun? O gemiyi? Ama onlar [b]insan[/b] bile değiller! [b]Efendilerinin disiplini ve rehberliği olmadan, senin gibi isyan ve cinayete yönelirler[/b].
[b]Adéwalé: Keşke bu doğru olsaydı[/b].

[b] Adéwalé[/b]: ...Ama içimde bir gelgitin değiştiğini hissediyorum. Artık genç değilim. Enerjimi [b] özgürlük[/b] için mücadele edenlere adamalıyım. [b] Kardeşlikteki inancımı[/b], bana yardım edecek herkesin yanında onları savunmak için kullanacağım.
[h1]𝓕𝓻𝓮𝓮𝓭𝓸𝓶[/h1]

128715630,"{'steamid': '76561199441975789', 'num_games_owned': 21, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1820, 'last_played': 1672479177}",schinese,我解放了全宇宙的黑奴,1671270205,1671270205,True,7,5,0.614174604415893555,0,True,False,False,True,,,

128704085,"{'steamid': '76561198373502045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1686939731}",english,"Assassin's Creed: Freedom Cry.
While not throwing stealth away completely, this game trades up stealth for some head on action sequences.
You play as Adewale, 15 years after the events of Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.
Older, wiser and now a fully trained assassin. He even gets his own murder hood.

Much of the in game assets were from ACIV:BF so the graphics are more or less the same. Gameplay wise as well, but again more action than stealth really. And his attack animations, though not as fluid or graceful as i expected assassins would be, he has a sort of brutal flair that really defines him as an assassin. Not just Edward Kenway reskinned to be Adewale.
Weapons in Freedom Cry are different as they got rid of swords and daggers. You get machetes for Adewale instead. (This does not prevent you from picking up and using a sword from a slain enemy.)
No flintlock pistols, just a blunderbuss for you, Ade.
You still have your own pair of Hidden Blades of course.

The whole campaign itself is short and sweet. It left me wanting more from it, more of what happens to Adewale, more of what becomes of the liberated slaves and their resistance and more of what happened to the Assassins after Black Flag.
For a DLC turned standalone game, it has a lot more content than one would expect.
Honestly i thought it was just gonna be a bunch of uninspired self contained missions, but this totally blew me away.
I dare say Adewale was more fun to play with than Connor. But of course, that is my opinion.

Get it on sale if you feel that $15 is still too much. Get it however you can as it is a very good game and you won't really regret playing it.",1671252414,1671252414,True,16,3,0.366248488426208496,1,True,False,False,True,,,

126427865,"{'steamid': '76561198154862269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1657492685}",english,"For better or worse, Freedom Cry feels like an entire Assassin's Creed game distilled into five hours. That’s good, but it’s an Assassin’s Creed game that doesn’t include many of the steps forward that Black Flag so recently made. I couldn't help but leave disappointed by the bland missions and ironic loss of freedom, which is definitely a bummer. But despite this, Adewale's journey genuinely moved me, as it dealt with themes and situations rarely explored in video games. A story unfettered by Assassin versus Templar mysticism keeps it grounded and powerful.",1669228380,1669228380,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,True,,,

Black Flag'de yan paket olarak bulunmasına rağmen bilmediğimden dolayı ayrıyetten almıştım. Eğer sizde de varsa Black Flag siz almayın. İncelememe geçersem. Oyun Blag Flag'deki yardımcı kaptanımız Adewale abimin Assassin'ler adına kendi ülkesine bir göreve gidince. Köleliğe düşen milletini kurtarma çabası. Blag Flag'in bir DLC'si olmasına rağmen kendisine özel küçücük tatlı bir haritaya ve hikayesiyle alakalı minik minik yeni mekaniklere sahip. Yani oyun DLC felan diye aynı oyuna 2--3 side story eklemiyor kendi çapında minicik bir oyun gibi. 1-2 tane savaş hatası dışı da buglarla karşılaşmadım. Şahsen bir DLC hikayesinden bekleyebileceğin ortalama seviyedeki bir oyun.
Kendilerini ben beğendim bunu almak yerine Blag Flag'i alıp oynarsınız yeterince yeterli bir oyun. Öneriyorum. 🥉🅑🅡🅞🅝🅩🥉",1669133929,1684792095,True,0,0,0.517241418361663818,0,True,False,False,True,,,

125463692,{'steamid': '76561198063271193', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 404, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1668429415}",english,"Despite this being a DLC for some reason steam has this as a seperate game. This is small, even smaller than liberation. The storyline is great and very fitting for Adewale and definitely works well.
What doesn't work well is the port to pc. The framerate is really bad in some places and can really affect gameplay, however it wasn't always bad and i pushed through to the end.

I enjoyed the game otherwise but i found the ""random event"" slave liberations far too frequent, crossing over into one another making for a confusing time. Also there were far too many enemies(guards and slavers) always looking out for trouble in such small locations.
Despite this it has many great mechanics from black flag as well as some new ones.
Unfortunately i cannot recommend this on steam. The port can make it completely unplayable for some people and just not worth the effort.
If you can get it on sale on console do that and you will have less problems.",1668434531,1668434664,False,9,2,0.626488208770751953,0,True,False,False,True,,,

120305594,"{'steamid': '76561198046016487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1660004878}",english,"Very bland dlc... very repetitive. Tail this person... free slaves... free some more slaves because the mission requires more to be freed to be unlocked. Free this plantation, and tail some more people... just seems to be very meh, almost like there was a lot of grinding with how repetitive the free slave events were. Ship upgrades were done within the first few hours of play, all rewards are given after freeing 400 slaves, which can be done pretty quickly by taking slave ships. I get it, it was a dlc, not a full game, just felt like there could've been more done to make this dlc seem more awesome, just a little over 6 hours and I beat it, that was also taking into consideration the troubleshooting I took to setup the controller as it was acting weird, and some of the running around just killing guards because I got bored. But anyways, the idea of Adewale (probably spelled the name wrong) going around fighting against slavery = awesome idea. Story, though, just wasn't well written in my opinion and it seemed rushed.",1660005515,1660005515,False,5,0,0.558528423309326172,0,True,False,False,False,,,

120056252,"{'steamid': '76561197963704002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1659625925}",english,"[h1]Meh[/h1]

If you liked [i]Black Flag[/i], you'll probably like this since [i]Assassin's Creed Freedom Cry[/i] is the exact same game on a smaller scale. At best, I would describe this game as a distraction. It's not bad, per se, but it's not good either.
[h1]The Story[/h1]

As far as I can tell, this game doesn't really have a narrative you can hang on to. It starts with Adewale liberating a Templar package and immediately being cast ashore without a ship. Then stuff happens. It feels confused as to what it wants the story to be. There are three narratives all happening simultaneously:
- The Templar Package
- Liberating the Slaves
- The Scientific Expedition
None of these get resolved.
- The package is cast aside for the other 2 narratives, and makes an appearance at the end. What was it? Who knows.

- For as many slaves as you liberate, you never actually liberate Saint Domingue, not even for a moment. You don't lead a rebellion.[spoiler] You just kill the governor and are told he will just be replaced[/spoiler]. Cool.
- The scientific expedition to measure the circumference of the earth is infiltrated by your Maroons, and then...? Literally nothing comes of it. Everything in this game is of no consequence.

I do find it hard to believe Ubisoft couldn't find something interesting happening in the early 1700's Caribbean. And even if this was meant to tell a losing story, they didn't really deliver any impact. You really are left with, ""Thanks Ade, all this busy work will all pay off in 60 or so years."" Maybe have the first few missions be Adewale, and the last half be the slave rebellion where his grandchild plays a major roll?
The story is just not engaging. I regularly forgot what was happening and the game can be finished in an afternoon.
[h1]The Gameplay[/h1]

It's exactly like [i]Black Flag[/i]. The additions are RNG world events that give you the opportunity to free slaves. Most of these are a waste of time, yielding you 2-5 slaves/Maroons, whereas raiding a plantation or a slave ship will get you 30-100. The world events are a distraction, more so during missions where they are not disabled for some reason. So if you get distracted on a mission, and you fail (e.g. you are seen and the mission specifies you can't be), you also fail the mission. Fun.

Missions still have a bunch of nonsensical side objectives like killing 5 guards with a blunderbuss on a stealth mission. Ubisoft maintained the tradition of making these necessary to get 100% completion. It's amazing how long they held on the that terrible piece of design. Since there is no reward beyond getting 100%, I just skipped any I didn't incidentally get.

Upgrades come easy. The more slaves you free, the better equipment you get. This can also be a bit grindy since slave ships and plantations are on a cool down timer. Nothing is more grindy than upgrading your ship.

You need a shit ton of wood and metal which you can only get by raiding ships. This means sailing around trying to find ships with wood and/or metal, raiding them, and doing it again and again and again. Luckily, this game is not hard, and you really don't need those upgrades. But if that's your idea of fun, have at it.

The side content is also most generously described as a distraction. Most of it is small islands with a single treasure chest. The first time that happened, I was a bit disappointed. Then it happened again. And again. And again. Ubisoft, if you're gonna pad the game, at least make it interesting.

Sailing to a remote island that the game has pointed out for you, to get pretty much nothing, sucks. This could honestly be fixed if you remove the map markers. That way, players get a sense of, ""Oooo I wonder what's on that island!"" Then, even if it's only one treasure chest, it feels like you [i]found[/i] something. It's a little secret, and you found it! Instead, it's, ""Hey, look over here. There's something on this island, don't you wanna see???"" You are enticing the player to go to a spot, the understanding is it will be something significant. It's the difference between finding a quarter, and someone saying, ""I put something cool over by that tree!"" Then you go to the tree and find a lousy quarter.
[h1]Overall[/h1]

If you like [i]Assassin's Creed[/i] you'll likely find this to be a an enjoyable, short little romp. It's a competent game. I didn't run into any bugs. I liked the traditional music, and the idea of kinda maybe starting a slave rebellion. But overall, it was just a hollow experience. It doesn't contribute really anything to the main series. It's a distraction.

Quick shout out to Ubisoft who made me purchase this game even though I had the DLC version for [i]Black Flag[/i] that, for some reason, they couldn't activate on my account, and instead repeatedly accused me of pirating the game, then deleted my [i]Black Flag[/i] save file. They made it up to me by restoring my save file in a corrupted and irreparable state.

118927159,"{'steamid': '76561198091494295', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1800, 'last_played': 1658010539}",english,"As a standalone expansion version to the Black Flag DLC, I do have to say that Freedom Cry is one of the better DLC campaigns put out. Still, with price, you’re better off waiting for a sale or just playing the game through Black Flag. Even when considering it seems the only issue/difference is that the Black Flag version has a bug where certain weapons don’t make sounds, I’d still say the Black Flag version wins out (you can also copy the sound files from this version to fix the issue too, hint hint).

For the most part, Freedom cry plays like a smaller, more condensed version of Black Flag. You still have the fun ship combat and exploration, though they’re more limited in upgrades, locations, and collectibles. Most unlocks and upgrades end up being relegated to secret-finding or freeing slaves/maroons, which is a nice change of pace.

Still, the main issue of Freedom Cry is that it is exceedingly short. Most island locations really only have one to three chests to unlock, and with only 9 main missions to complete, most people can easily finish everything this game has to offer in under 10 hours.

All in all, while I do recommend the experience of Freedom Cry, it comes with the qualification that it is very short and is best purchased as part of Black Flag or at a heavy discount. If you’re the type of person who wants some more Black Flag gameplay, this should be a nice little time waster for you (and if you still want more, just get Assassin’s Creed Rogue. It’s actually almost a full-length Assassin‘s Creed Game for only a slightly higher price).",1658010575,1658010575,True,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

117599383,"{'steamid': '76561198236463120', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1656182157}",french,"08/20
Après avoir digéré Black flag, le titre paraît vraiment beaucoup trop fade. Surtout en 2022.
Plus bugué que le jeu de base.

La bande son est très belle, Adewalé charismatique et le message intéressant. Mais les 3h de durée de vie ne réussissent clairement pas à hisser le jeu au delà d'une mise à jour mineure du jeu de base.
L'apparition du générique conduira forcement à une réaction de type ""Ah.."".
Si l'équipe a réalisé ce DLC en plus d'un jour/homme, ils se sont clairement foutu de la gueule de leur N+1.
A titre de comparaison : Aujourd'hui, le DLC blood and wine de Witcher III est au même prix d'achat que Freedom Cry.
Ce n'est pas normal
À considérer pour un prix de 1-2 euro pour un fan hardcore, tout en sachant qu'il n'y aura pas de révélation sur le présent.",1656182018,1656183174,False,0,0,0,0,True,False,False,False,,,

117131239,{'steamid': '76561198031382145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1655479649}",english,"My 43 minutes ""playing"" are, in fact, messing around with the custom launcher which got downloaded, crashed, refused to accept the CD key which Steam had, and a bunch of time waiting for UBSort support to reply to chat messages.
If a game is on Steem, it should work out of the box and not require custom launchers. THat's literally what steam is.

I knew there was a reason that I had gone and hidden all UBSoft games from my Steam account. I thought maybe it was gameplay. Nope. It's the launcher issue, I think. I will wait until this is a Steam game before buying it on Steam, and I don't like having multiple launchers.
If you want to play it, I recommend you go buy direct from UBSoft so that their launcher might work.",1655480105,1655480105,False,5,1,0.533510684967041016,0,True,False,False,False,,,
